text: I don't know if you've noticed this
about me but I'm constantly trying to
outdo myself with desserts that have
less and less ingredients today's
dessert has only four ingredients it's a
chocolate pudding cake and it's a
spectacular dessert start off by
separating 6 large eggs I like to use
the egg shell method what do you guys
think how do you separate your eggs egg
whites you don't need right now to set
those aside for a sec - the egg yolks
add a half a cup of sugar and 6 ounces
of chocolate that's been melted this is
semi-sweet chocolate I look for like a
56 to a 61 percent chocolate anything
stronger might be a little too bitter
whisk together just combine everything
really nicely and then you can set this
aside two egg whites back in add a half
a teaspoon of coarse salt and then whisk
this there we go these nice beaters it
shouldn't take you long you can do this
by hand but I don't recommend it it's
exhausting
this just needs to be beaten to soft
peaks which I think we are already there
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
and get a pot of water on to boil
because this needs to be baked in a
water bath I'm going to use my whisk to
whisk in about a third of the egg whites
into the chocolate mixture and then I'm
going to fold the rest in and that makes
it so that the egg whites don't break
down too much and they give tons of
lightness and fluffiness to bake to it
fold in the rest the cool thing about
baking with whipped egg whites like this
meringues is that they expand in the
oven so if you put it in and it's this
high when it comes out of the oven it's
this high it's incredible
just cut down through the center and
then bring it up and around using a
spatula and usually we say gently but
thoroughly because if you over fold all
those little air cells will break down
and then all that beating will be for
naught so just get it fully combined
sometimes we leave a few streaks of egg
white in there so that you know that
it's not over beaten okay so I have my
baking pan in a roasting pan the
roasting pan is going to get water in it
the baking pan is a 2 quart baking dish
that I have buttered and then dusted
with sugar pour your mixture in so I'm
going to add boiling water to this pan
but I want to do at the oven so it
doesn't slosh around too much put your
pan with your baking dish in the oven
and then fill about halfway up the sides
with water this will give a nice gentle
cooking environment the cake will need
to bake for about 25 to 35 minutes when
it's done what happens is the top layer
becomes like this sort of light fluffy
cake and the bottom layer is sort of a
custard pudding you can dust it with a
little bit of confectioner's sugar if
you want alright let's see what it looks
like inside I'm going to taste
I'm a big fan of chocolate desserts this
is a particular favorite because it's
just so easy mmm and fantastically
delicious
you
